messages.content: What kind of nodes are included in ComfyUI Bmad Nodes?
Miscellaneous assortment of custom nodes for ComfyUI, which can be roughly categorized into: api, computer vision, and general utility.
What does the API nodes category help with?
They are designed to help setup API requests, although they are basic.
What is the main purpose of the computer vision nodes category?
Mainly for masking and collage purposes.
What does the general utility nodes category provide?
It simplifies the workflow setup or implements some missing basic functionality.
What does the Color Clip node do?
Clips the color (or all the other colors) from an image. Both the target color or the complement can be set to white, black or remain untouched.
What is the Color Clip ADE20k node used for?
It is similar to Color Clip, but picks the color from the ADE20k class list. It is only useful for ADE20k semantic segmented images.
What is the purpose of the MonoMerge node?
Selects the maximum (or minimum) value between two images. Mainly used for mask composition.
How does the Add String to Many node operate?
It appends / prepends the string `to_add` to all the other strings.
What does the AdjustRect node do?

Receives a rectangle and returns a new rectangle that shares the same center but with width adjusted to a multiple of `xm` and height to a multiple of `ym`. Setting `round_mode` to **exact** will return a rectangle with the exact defined dimensions.
How does the Conditioning Grid (string) node generate conditioning?
It generates the conditioning from the given strings (only).
What is required for the Conditioning Grid (string) Advanced node to work?
It requires BlenderNeko's [Advanced CLIP Text Encode](https://github.com/BlenderNeko/ComfyUI_ADV_CLIP_emb).
What does the CLIPEncodeMultiple node do?
Receives individual strings → CLIPEncodes each → returns conditioning list.
What does the CLIPEncodeMultipleAdvanced node use?
It uses BlenderNeko's [Advanced CLIP Text Encode](https://github.com/BlenderNeko/ComfyUI_ADV_CLIP_emb).
What does the Filter Contour node do?
It outputs contours depending on their fitness, where the fitness function must be provided within the node's text box.
